neem.caution: Consult a professional; internal use not recommended without guidance.
neem.short: Tree with pinnate leaves, common in tropical regions.

rose.uses: Ornamental; petals used in perfumery and teas.
rose.caution: Safe; some people may have allergies.
rose.short: Shrub with thorny stems and fragrant flowers.

aloe_vera.uses: Soothing burns, cuts, and skin irritation. Used in cosmetics.
aloe_vera.caution: Generally safe for topical use; avoid ingesting latex.
aloe_vera.short: Succulent with thick, fleshy leaves containing healing gel.

lavender.uses: Aromatherapy, relaxation, insect repellent, culinary herb.
lavender.caution: Generally safe; may cause drowsiness in large amounts.
lavender.short: Fragrant herb with purple flower spikes and silvery leaves.

eucalyptus.uses: Essential oils for respiratory relief, antiseptic properties.
eucalyptus.caution: Toxic if ingested; use only as directed.
eucalyptus.short: Fast-growing tree with aromatic, oval-shaped leaves.

basil.uses: Culinary herb, traditional medicine, insect repellent.
basil.caution: Generally safe; avoid large medicinal doses during pregnancy.
basil.short: Aromatic herb with green leaves, popular in cooking.

mint.uses: Digestive aid, tea, culinary flavoring, aromatherapy.
mint.caution: Generally safe; may worsen acid reflux in some people.
mint.short: Perennial herb with serrated leaves and cooling properties.

rosemary.uses: Culinary herb, memory enhancement, hair care, antioxidant.
rosemary.caution: Safe in culinary amounts; avoid large doses if pregnant.
rosemary.short: Evergreen shrub with needle-like leaves and blue flowers.

turmeric.caution: May interact with blood thinners; avoid large doses before surgery.
turmeric.short: Rhizomatous herb with orange-colored roots and yellow flowers.

ginger.uses: Digestive aid, nausea relief, culinary spice, anti-inflammatory.
ginger.caution: May interact with blood thinners; limit if taking medications.
ginger.short: Tropical plant with thick, knobby rhizomes and lance-shaped leaves.

garlic.caution: May increase bleeding risk; avoid before surgery.
garlic.short: Bulbous plant with flat leaves and strong pungent odor.

onion.uses: Culinary ingredient, antimicrobial, traditional cold remedy.
onion.caution: Generally safe; may cause digestive upset in sensitive individuals.
onion.short: Bulbous vegetable with layered structure and pungent flavor.

lemon.uses: Vitamin C source, culinary use, cleaning agent, aromatherapy.
lemon.caution: May increase photosensitivity; avoid excessive consumption.
lemon.short: Citrus tree with oval leaves and yellow acidic fruits.

orange.uses: Vitamin C source, culinary use, essential oils, juice.
orange.caution: Generally safe; may interact with certain medications.
orange.short: Evergreen tree with glossy leaves and round orange fruits.

mango.uses: Nutritious fruit, traditional medicine, antioxidant source.
mango.caution: May cause allergic reactions in sensitive individuals.
mango.short: Tropical tree with large leaves and sweet, fleshy fruits.

banana.uses: Nutritious fruit, potassium source, energy boost.
banana.caution: Generally safe; may worsen kidney problems if consumed excessively.
banana.short: Large herb with broad leaves and curved yellow fruits.

apple.uses: Nutritious fruit, fiber source, antioxidants, culinary use.
apple.caution: Seeds contain cyanide compounds; avoid eating in large quantities.
apple.short: Deciduous tree with oval leaves and round fruits.

tomato.uses: Culinary vegetable, lycopene source, antioxidant properties.
tomato.caution: Green parts contain solanine; avoid eating unripe fruits.
tomato.short: Vine plant with compound leaves and red fleshy fruits.

potato.uses: Staple food crop, carbohydrate source, vitamin C.
potato.caution: Green potatoes contain solanine; avoid eating sprouted tubers.
potato.short: Herbaceous plant with underground tubers and white flowers.

carrot.uses: Vitamin A source, culinary vegetable, eye health support.
carrot.caution: Generally safe; excessive consumption may cause orange skin tint.
carrot.short: Root vegetable with feathery leaves and orange taproot.

spinach.uses: Leafy green vegetable, iron source, folate, vitamins.
spinach.caution: High in oxalates; limit if prone to kidney stones.
spinach.short: Annual plant with dark green, arrow-shaped leaves.

cabbage.uses: Culinary vegetable, vitamin C source, fermented foods.
cabbage.caution: May interfere with thyroid function if consumed excessively.
cabbage.short: Biennial plant with large, round heads of tightly packed leaves.

broccoli.uses: Nutritious vegetable, vitamin C and K source, antioxidants.
broccoli.caution: May cause gas in sensitive individuals; generally safe.
broccoli.short: Plant with thick stalk and large flowering head of green buds.

cauliflower.uses: Low-carb vegetable substitute, vitamin C source, fiber.
cauliflower.caution: Generally safe; may cause digestive upset in some people.
cauliflower.short: Plant with large, white, compact flowering head.

lettuce.uses: Salad green, low-calorie food, hydration source.
lettuce.caution: Generally safe; wash thoroughly to avoid contamination.
lettuce.short: Annual plant with broad, tender leaves in rosette formation.

cucumber.uses: Hydrating food, skin care, low-calorie snack.
cucumber.caution: Generally safe; may cause bitter taste if overripe.
cucumber.short: Climbing vine with large leaves and cylindrical green fruits.

pumpkin.uses: Culinary use, vitamin A source, seeds for nutrition.
pumpkin.caution: Generally safe; seeds may interact with certain medications.
pumpkin.short: Trailing vine with large leaves and round orange fruits.

sunflower.uses: Ornamental, oil production, edible seeds, bird food.
sunflower.caution: Generally safe; some people may be allergic to seeds.
sunflower.short: Tall annual plant with large yellow flower heads.

marigold.caution: Generally safe; may cause skin irritation in sensitive individuals.
marigold.short: Annual flower with bright orange or yellow blooms.

jasmine.caution: Generally safe; avoid ingesting large quantities.

hibiscus.caution: May lower blood pressure; consult doctor if on medication.

bamboo.uses: Construction material, food (shoots), ornamental, erosion control.
bamboo.caution: Some species may be invasive; shoots need proper preparation.
bamboo.short: Fast-growing grass with hollow, segmented stems.

oak.uses: Timber, acorns for wildlife, tannins, landscaping.
oak.caution: Acorns contain tannins; require processing before consumption.
oak.short: Large deciduous tree with lobed leaves and acorns.

pine.uses: Timber, resin, pine nuts, essential oils, Christmas trees.
pine.caution: Some species' needles may be toxic; avoid during pregnancy.
pine.short: Evergreen conifer with needle-like leaves and cones.

maple.uses: Maple syrup, timber, ornamental, fall foliage.
maple.caution: Generally safe; some species may cause skin irritation.
maple.short: Deciduous tree with palmate leaves and winged seeds.

willow.uses: Traditional pain relief, basket weaving, erosion control.
willow.caution: Contains salicin; avoid if allergic to aspirin.
willow.short: Tree with long, narrow leaves and drooping branches.

birch.uses: Timber, birch beer, traditional medicine, paper making.
birch.caution: May cause allergic reactions in sensitive individuals.
birch.short: Deciduous tree with white bark and small triangular leaves.

cedar.uses: Timber, essential oils, insect repellent, construction.
cedar.caution: Essential oil may cause skin irritation; avoid during pregnancy.
cedar.short: Evergreen conifer with aromatic wood and needle clusters.

cherry.uses: Edible fruits, ornamental flowers, timber, traditional medicine.
cherry.caution: Leaves and bark contain cyanide; avoid in large quantities.
cherry.short: Deciduous tree with serrated leaves and stone fruits.

peach.uses: Edible fruits, ornamental, traditional medicine, cosmetics.
peach.caution: Pit contains cyanide; leaves may cause skin irritation.
peach.short: Small tree with lance-shaped leaves and fuzzy fruits.

pear.uses: Edible fruits, timber, ornamental, traditional medicine.
pear.caution: Seeds contain small amounts of cyanide; generally safe.
pear.short: Deciduous tree with oval leaves and bell-shaped fruits.

avocado.uses: Nutritious fruits, healthy fats, cosmetics, culinary oil.
avocado.caution: Toxic to pets; high calorie content for humans.
avocado.short: Evergreen tree with large oval leaves and green fruits.

coconut.uses: Coconut water, oil, fiber, food, construction material.
coconut.caution: Generally safe; may cause allergic reactions in some people.
coconut.short: Tall palm tree with large pinnate leaves and coconuts.

date.uses: Sweet fruits, syrup, traditional medicine, landscaping.
date.caution: High sugar content; consume in moderation if diabetic.
date.short: Palm tree with pinnate leaves and clusters of dates.

fig.uses: Edible fruits, traditional medicine, ornamental, fiber source.
fig.caution: Latex may cause skin irritation; generally safe to eat.
fig.short: Deciduous tree with large lobed leaves and soft fruits.

grape.uses: Wine production, fresh fruit, raisins, antioxidants.
grape.caution: Generally safe; alcohol content in wine requires moderation.
grape.short: Climbing vine with lobed leaves and clustered fruits.

strawberry.uses: Fresh fruit, jams, desserts, vitamin C source.
strawberry.caution: May cause allergic reactions; generally safe for most people.
strawberry.short: Low-growing plant with three-leaflet leaves and red berries.

blueberry.uses: Antioxidant-rich fruit, baking, jams, health supplements.
blueberry.caution: May interact with blood thinners; generally very safe.
blueberry.short: Shrub with oval leaves and small blue berries.

raspberry.uses: Fresh fruit, jams, tea from leaves, antioxidants.
raspberry.caution: Leaves used medicinally should be consumed with caution.
raspberry.short: Cane plant with compound leaves and aggregate red fruits.

blackberry.uses: Fresh fruit, jams, traditional medicine, antioxidants.
blackberry.caution: Thorns can cause injury; fruit is generally safe.
blackberry.short: Thorny cane with compound leaves and dark aggregate fruits.

watermelon.uses: Hydrating fruit, low calorie snack, seeds for nutrition.
watermelon.caution: Generally safe; may cause digestive upset if consumed excessively.

cantaloupe.uses: Nutritious fruit, vitamin A and C source, low calorie.
cantaloupe.caution: Wash thoroughly; may harbor bacteria on rind.

pineapple.caution: May cause mouth irritation; avoid excessive consumption.

papaya.uses: Digestive fruit, enzyme source, traditional medicine.
papaya.caution: Unripe fruit may be harmful during pregnancy.
papaya.short: Tree with large palmate leaves and orange oval fruits.

kiwi.uses: Vitamin C rich fruit, digestive aid, antioxidants.
kiwi.caution: May cause allergic reactions in some individuals.
kiwi.short: Climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and fuzzy brown fruits.

pomegranate.caution: May interact with certain medications; generally safe.
pomegranate.short: Shrub with narrow leaves and red fruits with many seeds.

lime.uses: Culinary use, vitamin C, traditional medicine, beverages.
lime.caution: May increase photosensitivity; acidic nature may erode teeth.

grapefruit.uses: Vitamin C source, weight management, antioxidants.
grapefruit.caution: Interacts with many medications; consult doctor if on medication.
grapefruit.short: Citrus tree with large glossy leaves and large acidic fruits.

chili.uses: Culinary spice, pain relief, metabolism boost, preservation.
chili.caution: Can cause burning sensation; avoid touching eyes after handling.
chili.short: Annual plant with small leaves and hot, colorful fruits.

bell_pepper.uses: Culinary vegetable, vitamin C source, antioxidants.

eggplant.caution: Contains solanine; cook thoroughly before eating.

zucchini.uses: Low-calorie vegetable, pasta substitute, baking ingredient.
zucchini.caution: Generally safe; bitter taste may indicate toxic compounds.
zucchini.short: Vine plant with large leaves and elongated green fruits.

sweet_potato.uses: Nutritious root vegetable, vitamin A source, fiber.

sweet_potato.short: Vine with heart-shaped leaves and orange tuberous roots.

beetroot.caution: May cause red urine; high in oxalates.

radish.uses: Culinary vegetable, digestive aid, vitamin C source.
radish.caution: May cause gas; generally safe in normal amounts.
radish.short: Plant with lobed leaves and small, pungent root vegetable.

turnip.uses: Root vegetable, greens for salads, traditional medicine.
turnip.caution: May interfere with thyroid function if consumed excessively.
turnip.short: Plant with rough leaves and white-purple root vegetable.

parsnip.uses: Root vegetable, fiber source, potassium rich.
parsnip.caution: Sap may cause skin irritation; cook before eating.
parsnip.short: Plant with compound leaves and cream-colored taproot.

celery.uses: Low-calorie vegetable, potassium source, traditional medicine.

celery.short: Plant with compound leaves and crisp, fibrous stalks.

asparagus.uses: Nutritious vegetable, folate source, diuretic properties.
asparagus.caution: May cause strong-smelling urine; generally safe.
asparagus.short: Perennial plant with feathery foliage and edible spears.

artichoke.uses: Edible flower buds, liver support, antioxidants.
artichoke.caution: May cause allergic reactions in some individuals.
artichoke.short: Large plant with silvery leaves and edible flower heads.

corn.uses: Staple grain, animal feed, biofuel, food products.
corn.caution: May cause allergic reactions; high glycemic index.
corn.short: Tall grass with large leaves and kerneled ears.

wheat.uses: Staple grain for bread, pasta, flour production.

rice.uses: Staple grain, gluten-free food, rice products.
rice.caution: May contain arsenic; rinse before cooking.

barley.uses: Cereal grain, brewing, animal feed, soup ingredient.
barley.caution: Contains gluten; may cause allergic reactions.
barley.short: Cereal grass with long awns and dense grain heads.

oats.uses: Breakfast cereal, cholesterol reduction, fiber source.
oats.caution: Generally safe; may be contaminated with gluten.
oats.short: Cereal grass with loose, open grain panicles.

quinoa.caution: Wash thoroughly to remove saponins; generally safe.
quinoa.short: Plant with broad leaves and dense clusters of small seeds.

soybean.uses: Protein source, oil production, tofu, traditional foods.
soybean.caution: May cause allergic reactions; hormone-like effects debated.
soybean.short: Legume plant with trifoliate leaves and protein-rich pods.

peas.uses: Protein-rich vegetable, fiber source, nitrogen fixation.
peas.caution: Generally safe; high fiber may cause digestive upset.
peas.short: Climbing plant with compound leaves and edible pods.

beans.uses: Protein source, fiber, folate, various culinary uses.
beans.caution: Raw beans contain toxins; must be cooked thoroughly.
beans.short: Climbing plant with trifoliate leaves and edible pods.

lentils.uses: Protein source, fiber, iron, quick-cooking legume.

lentils.short: Annual plant with small compound leaves and lens-shaped seeds.

chickpeas.uses: Protein source, hummus ingredient, fiber, folate.
chickpeas.caution: May cause digestive upset; generally safe when cooked.
chickpeas.short: Plant with compound leaves and inflated pods containing round seeds.

peanut.uses: Protein source, oil production, butter, snack food.
peanut.caution: Major allergen; can cause severe allergic reactions.
peanut.short: Low plant with compound leaves and underground pods.

sunflower_seeds.uses: Healthy snack, oil source, vitamin E, protein.
sunflower_seeds.caution: High calorie; may cause allergic reactions in some people.
sunflower_seeds.short: Seeds from large yellow flower heads of tall annual plants.

almonds.uses: Healthy nuts, oil source, milk substitute, protein.
almonds.caution: May cause allergic reactions; bitter almonds contain cyanide.
almonds.short: Tree with lance-shaped leaves and hard-shelled nuts.

walnuts.uses: Omega-3 fatty acids, brain health, protein source.
walnuts.caution: May cause allergic reactions; high calorie content.
walnuts.short: Tree with compound leaves and hard-shelled brain-shaped nuts.

cashews.uses: Protein source, healthy fats, dairy alternatives.
cashews.caution: Raw cashews contain toxins; may cause allergic reactions.
cashews.short: Tree with large leaves and kidney-shaped nuts.

pistachios.caution: May cause allergic reactions; high calorie content.
pistachios.short: Small tree with compound leaves and green-purple nuts.

hazelnuts.uses: Culinary nuts, oil source, confectionery ingredient.
hazelnuts.caution: May cause allergic reactions; generally safe in moderation.
hazelnuts.short: Shrub with broad, serrated leaves and small round nuts.

pecans.uses: Culinary nuts, oil source, baking ingredient.
pecans.caution: May cause allergic reactions; high fat content.
pecans.short: Large tree with compound leaves and oval nuts.

macadamia.uses: Premium nuts, oil source, cosmetic ingredient.
macadamia.caution: Very high calorie; toxic to dogs and cats.

brazil_nuts.caution: Very high selenium; limit consumption to avoid toxicity.
brazil_nuts.short: Large rainforest tree with large leaves and triangular nuts.

coffee.caution: Caffeine content; avoid excessive consumption during pregnancy.

cacao.caution: Contains caffeine and theobromine; toxic to pets.
cacao.short: Tropical tree with large leaves and pods containing cocoa beans.

vanilla.caution: Generally safe; synthetic vanilla may cause reactions.
vanilla.short: Climbing orchid with thick leaves and aromatic seed pods.

cinnamon.uses: Culinary spice, blood sugar regulation, antimicrobial.
cinnamon.caution: Large amounts may be toxic; avoid if on blood thinners.
cinnamon.short: Evergreen tree with aromatic bark and oval leaves.

cardamom.uses: Culinary spice, digestive aid, breath freshener.
cardamom.caution: May interact with certain medications; generally safe.
cardamom.short: Perennial herb with large leaves and small aromatic pods.

cloves.uses: Culinary spice, dental pain relief, antimicrobial.
cloves.caution: Essential oil may cause skin irritation; use sparingly.
cloves.short: Evergreen tree with aromatic flower buds and oval leaves.

nutmeg.caution: Large amounts can be toxic; may cause hallucinations.
nutmeg.short: Evergreen tree with glossy leaves and aromatic seeds.

black_pepper.uses: Culinary spice, digestive aid, nutrient absorption enhancer.
black_pepper.caution: May increase absorption of medications; generally safe.
black_pepper.short: Climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and peppercorn clusters.

oregano.caution: May interact with diabetes medications; generally safe.
oregano.short: Perennial herb with small oval leaves and tiny white flowers.

thyme.caution: May slow blood clotting; avoid before surgery.

sage.uses: Culinary herb, memory support, traditional medicine.
sage.caution: Avoid during pregnancy; limit long-term use.
sage.short: Perennial herb with gray-green leaves and purple flower spikes.

parsley.uses: Culinary herb, vitamin K source, breath freshener.
parsley.caution: Large amounts may be harmful during pregnancy.
parsley.short: Biennial herb with bright green, divided leaves.

cilantro.uses: Culinary herb, heavy metal detox, digestive aid.
cilantro.caution: Some people have genetic aversion; generally safe.

dill.uses: Culinary herb, pickling spice, digestive aid.

fennel.uses: Culinary vegetable, digestive aid, traditional medicine.
fennel.caution: May have estrogen-like effects; avoid if pregnant.

chives.uses: Culinary herb, mild onion flavor, garnish.
chives.caution: Generally safe; may cause digestive upset in large amounts.
